metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15392 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient data validation in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 62.0.3202.62 allowed an attacker who can write to the Windows Registry to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted Windows Registry entry, related to PlatformIntegration.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15392` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308
chromium-browser-l10n - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308
chromium-chromedriver - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
